titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Collection of Latin American Exhibition Catalogs and Visual Resources
Latin American Exhibition Catalogs and Visual Resources
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Ashley James

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 23:00

did.unittitle: Collection of Latin American exhibition catalogs and visual resources
did.abstract: The collection contains published exhibition catalogs from various Latin American countries and mounted reproductions of individual artworks by Latin American artists.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Librarian for Latin American Studies, Jana Krentz, in January 2014. Materials may have originated from the Yale Department of Spanish and Portuguese.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection of Latin American Exhibition Catalogs and Visual Resources, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains published exhibition catalogs from various Latin American countries and mounted reproductions of individual artworks by Latin American and Spanish artists. The collection also includes a few original watercolors.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Published Works, 1976-2008. II. Reproductions, 1929-1991. III. Original Artwork, 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes a variety of exhibition catalogs, auction catalogs, brochures, pamphlets, and other art-related ephemera, primarily published in Brazil.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by year of publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes reproductions of individual artworks or other designs, such as magazine covers, mounted on either card stock or foam core.

unittitle.title: A Arte do Comércio: Sao Paulo 1900-1930

did.unittitle: [Careta: Um cruzeiro em todo o Brasil, No. 2.208]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains original watercolors and a Marilyn Monroe-inspired game.
